data.event: Davis grew into a Southern Pacific Railroad depot built in 1868.

event.title: shortened the town name simply to "Davis" in 1907

data.event: However, the post office at Davisville shortened the town name simply to "Davis" in 1907.
The name stuck, and the city of Davis was incorporated on March 28, 1917.

event.title: 1905 by the California State Legislature, Governor George Pardee selected

data.event: Following the passage of the University Farm Bill in 1905 by the California State Legislature, Governor George Pardee selected Davis out of 50 other sites as the future home to the University of California's University Farm, officially opening to students in 1908.

event.title: renamed the Northern Branch of the College of Agriculture in 1922

data.event: The farm, later renamed the Northern Branch of the College of Agriculture in 1922, was upgraded into the seventh UC general campus, the University of California, Davis, in 1959.

event.title: was upgraded into the seventh UC general campus, the University of California, Davis, in 1959

data.event: The farm, later renamed the Northern Branch of the College of Agriculture in 1922, was upgraded into the seventh UC general campus, the University of California, Davis, in 1959.
